intro: Forsskaolea scabra, commonly known as the rough Forsskaolea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough, hairy texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, spherical fruits. Forsskaolea scabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
